p: The final size data were fitted into a Bayesian hierarchical model ( Figure 1) to estimate the distribution of R 0 among flocks, resulting in a mean value of 5.5 (95% posterior credible interval: 3.4–18.3) and a variance of 11.3 (95%PCI: 1.7–298). The sensitivity of the diagnostic test (i.e., haemoagglutination inhibition) was estimated in the same model and was equal to 0.977 (95%PCI: 0.953–0.992) ( Table 2), which was insensitive to the choice of prior distribution (0.975 with uninformative prior).
